docs.title: Obsidian Various Complements Plugin
docs.text: This plugin for Obsidian enables you complete words like the auto-completion of IDE.

docs.title: ⌨️ Features
docs.text:
• Current file complement
  • Current vault complement
  • Custom dictionary complement
  • Internal link complement
  • Front matter complement
  • Predictable complement
  • Fallback linkify

docs.title: 🗺️ Support languages
docs.text: Language Support Recommended ⚙️ Strategy Issue English and similar yes default or english-only Japanese yes japanese Chinese yes chinese #7 Korean yes korean #232 Arabic yes arabic #2

docs.title: 📱 Support devices/OS
docs.text: Device/OS Support Windows as much as possible Mac yes Linux as much as possible Android as much as possible iPhone as much as possible iPad as much as possible

docs.title: 🖥️ Support views
docs.text:
Editor/Mode Support Source mode yes Live preview mode yes Legacy editor no

BACKLINK_PLUGIN_5234737_PLACEHOLDER

docs.title: Current file complement
docs.text: It suggests and completes the text with tokens that exists in a current file.

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text: It needs to enable a ⚙️ Enable Current file complement option.

docs.title: When does it update tokens?
docs.text:
• After saving a current file (every 2 seconds by Obsidian).
  • During starting Obsidian
  • After enabling this plugin
  • After some settings are updated

For details, you can see 🖼️ Status bar.

docs.title: Related Options
docs.text:
• ⚙️ Enable Current file complement
  • ⚙️ Min number of characters for indexing
  • ⚙️ Only complement English on current file complement
  • ⚙️ Min number of characters for trigger
  • ⚙️ Exclude word patterns for indexing

docs.title: Matching logic
docs.text:
• case-insensitive

BACKLINK_PLUGIN_5234737_PLACEHOLDER

docs.title: Current vault complement
docs.text: It suggests and completes the text with tokens in files in a current vault.

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text: It needs to enable a ⚙️ Enable Current vault complement option.

docs.title: When does it update tokens?
docs.text:
• After executing a 🎮 Reload current vault command
  • During starting Obsidian
  • After enabling this plugin
  • After some settings are updated

For details, you can see 🖼️ Status bar.

docs.title: Related Options
docs.text:
• ⚙️ Enable Current vault complement
  • ⚙️ Min number of characters for indexing
  • ⚙️ Include prefix path patterns
  • ⚙️ Exclude prefix path patterns
  • ⚙️ Exclude path glob patterns
  • ⚙️ Include only files under current directory
  • ⚙️ Min number of characters for trigger
  • ⚙️ Exclude word patterns for indexing
  • 🗑️deleted ⚙️ Open source file key

docs.title: Matching logic
docs.text:
• case-insensitive

docs.title: Custom dictionary complement
docs.text: It suggests and completes the text with words in 📚 Custom dictionaries.

docs.title: Images
docs.text:
Settings of the above demo are as follows.

  • ⚙️ Enable Custom dictionary complement: ON (required)
  • ⚙️ Custom dictionary paths: _Privates/dictionary-test.md
  • ⚙️ Column delimiter: Tab
  • ⚙️Word regex pattern:
  • ⚙️ Delimiter to hide a suggestion:
  • ⚙️ Delimiter to divide suggestions for display from ones for insertion:
  • ⚙️ Caret location symbol after complement: <CARET>

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text: It needs to enable a ⚙️ Enable Custom dictionary complement option and specify ⚙️ Custom dictionary paths.

docs.title: How do we create custom dictionaries?
docs.text: Please see 📚 Custom dictionaries. You can also register words on 🖼️ Add a word to a custom dictionary dialog opened by 🎮 Add a word to a custom dictionary or 🖱️ Add to custom dictionary context menu.

docs.title: When does it update tokens?
docs.text:
• After executing a 🎮 Reload custom dictionaries command
  • After registering from 🖼️ Add a word to a custom dictionary dialog
  • During starting Obsidian
  • After enabling this plugin
  • After some settings are updated

For details, you can see 🖼️ Status bar.

docs.title: Related Options
docs.text:
• ⚙️ Enable Custom dictionary complement
  • ⚙️ Custom dictionary paths
  • ⚙️ Column delimiter
  • ⚙️Word regex pattern
  • ⚙️ Delimiter to hide a suggestion
  • ⚙️ Delimiter to divide suggestions for display from ones for insertion
  • ⚙️ Caret location symbol after complement
  • ⚙️ Displayed text suffix
  • ⚙️ Min number of characters for trigger

docs.title: Matching logic
docs.text:
• If ⚙️ Match strategy is prefix
    • Prefix match (Ignore prefix-emoji)
      • Obs matches both Obsidian and 💎Obsidian
    • case-insensitive
  • If ⚙️ Match strategy is partial
    • Partial match
    • case-insensitive

docs.title: Realated
docs.text:
• 📚 Custom dictionaries
    • 📚 Custom dictionary formats
  • 📓 Custom dictionary examples

BACKLINK_PLUGIN_5234737_PLACEHOLDER

docs.title: Fallback linkify
docs.text:
The 'Fallback linkify' feature relaxes ⚙️ Match strategy or suggests creating a new 'Internal link' when no appropriate candidates, particularly for 'Internal links', are found.

Imagine this scenario: you expected a note that had already been created to be suggested as a candidate for an internal link... However, the note did not actually exist, and no suggestions were displayed, disrupting our writing flow. This feature is designed for such situations, allowing the immediate linkification of words or phrases entered just before, without interrupting the writing process.

The fallback process varies depending on the ⚙️ Match strategy setting. If the ⚙️ Match strategy is set to prefix, the first command will fallback to partial, and the second command will revert the phrase/word and convert it into an internal link. When the ⚙️ Match strategy is partial, it converts directly to an internal link on the first command.

If no other candidates besides 'Internal link' are displayed, and if 'partial match fallback' does not yield results, then immediately proceed to 'new link fallback'.

docs.title: Note
docs.text: The max number of suggestions provided by the 'new link fallback' matches the ⚙️ Max number of words as a phrase setting.

docs.title: Since
docs.text:
v10.0.0

BACKLINK_PLUGIN_5234737_PLACEHOLDER

docs.title: Front matter complement
docs.text: It suggests and completes the text with front matter properties only when the cursor is in the front matter.

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text: It needs to enable a ⚙️ Enable Front matter complement option.

docs.title: When does it update tokens?
docs.text:
• After Switching an active pane or file
  • During starting Obsidian
  • After enabling this plugin
  • After some settings are updated

For details, you can see 🖼️ Status bar.

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• It doesn't suggest tags that are not defined in the front matter
  • It doesn't suggest anything if key is a alias or aliases
  • It shows suggestions immediately even if it sets ⚙️ Min number of words for trigger or ⚙️ Max number of words as a phrase

docs.title: Related Options
docs.text:
• ⚙️ Enable Front matter complement
  • ⚙️ Match strategy in the front matter
  • ⚙️ Insert comma after completion

docs.title: Matching logic
docs.text:
• If ⚙️ Match strategy is prefix
    • Prefix match (Ignore prefix-emoji)
      • Obs matches both Obsidian and 💎Obsidian
    • case-insensitive
  • If ⚙️ Match strategy is partial
    • Partial match
    • case-insensitive

BACKLINK_PLUGIN_5234737_PLACEHOLDER

docs.title: Intelligent suggestion prioritization
docs.text: This feature optimizes the order of suggestions by queries the user has inputted and suggestions the user has selected in the past.

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text: It needs to enable a ⚙️ Enable Intelligent Suggestion Prioritization option.

docs.title: Sort orders
docs.text:
• The last selected suggestion, by each input, is always at the top (Since v7.2.0)
  • Otherwise, it sorts order by scores that calculate using the following formula
<Selected count> * <Bonus>

docs.title: Selected count
docs.text:
The number of times a word is selected. The histories will be removed depending on the following settings.

  • ⚙️ Max days to keep history
  • ⚙️ Max number of history to keep

docs.title: Bonus
docs.text: Last selected Magnification Within a minute 8 Within an hour 4 Within a day 2 Within a week 0.5 Within a 30 days 0.25

docs.title: Where is the user's selection history recorded?
Since v8.2.0
docs.text: It recorded in 📚 Histories.

docs.title: Prior to v8.2.0
docs.text: It recorded in data.json.

docs.title: Related Options
docs.text:
• ⚙️ Enable Intelligent Suggestion Prioritization
  • ⚙️ History file path
  • ⚙️ Max days to keep history
  • ⚙️ Max number of history to keep

docs.title: Since
docs.text:
v6.0.0

BACKLINK_PLUGIN_5234737_PLACEHOLDER

docs.title: Internal link complement
docs.text: It suggests and completes the text with internal links without input [[. It means that you can concentrate on writing sentences without concerning whether the word already exists as a link or not.

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text: It needs to enable a ⚙️ Enable Internal link complement option.

docs.title: When does it update tokens?
docs.text:
• After Switching an active pane or file
  • After saving a file when ⚙️ Update internal links on save is ON
  • During starting Obsidian
  • After enabling this plugin
  • After some settings are updated

For details, you can see 🖼️ Status bar.

docs.title: Related Options
docs.text:
• ⚙️ Enable Internal link complement
  • ⚙️ Suggest with an alias
  • ⚙️ Update internal links on save
  • ⚙️ Exclude self internal link
  • ⚙️ Exclude existing in active file internal links
  • ⚙️ Insert an alias that is transformed from the displayed internal link
  • ⚙️ Exclude prefix path patterns (Internal link complement)
  • ⚙️ Exclude path glob patterns
  • ⚙️ Front matter key for exclusion
  • ⚙️ Tags for exclusion
  • ⚙️ Min number of characters for trigger

docs.title: Related pop-up commands
docs.text:
• 🗨️select with custom alias
  • 🗨️select with query alias

docs.title: Matching logic
docs.text:
• If ⚙️ Match strategy is prefix
    • Prefix match (Ignore prefix-emoji)
      • Obs matches both Obsidian and 💎Obsidian
    • case-insensitive
  • If ⚙️ Match strategy is partial
    • Partial match
    • case-insensitive

BACKLINK_PLUGIN_5234737_PLACEHOLDER

docs.title: Predictable complement
docs.text: Predictable complement is similar to a Hippie completion for IntelliJ IDEA.

docs.title: Matching logic
docs.text:
• Always Prefix match
  • case-sensitive

docs.title: Default
docs.text:
Settings suitable for writing in English and other languages that use whitespace as separators.

You may want to use it if you write in English and other languages, which regards white spaces as separators.

docs.title: Since
docs.text:
v1.0.0

BACKLINK_PLUGIN_5234737_PLACEHOLDER

docs.title: English only
docs.text:
Settings suitable when there are no appropriate settings available, but you want to separate only English and non-English parts.

You may want to select it if you can't use the other strategies but only use it for English.

docs.title: Differences between default and english-only
docs.text:
default

english-only

docs.text: • Implement an "English only" Tokenizer · Issue #86

docs.title: 🎮 Add a word to a custom dictionary

BACKLINK_PLUGIN_5234737_PLACEHOLDER

docs.title: 🎮 Copy plugin settings
docs.text: Copy plugin settings of this plugin to clipboard. It is handy when we report an issue.

docs.title: Default hotkey
docs.text: • Nothing

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Below is an output example.

{
    "version": "4.2.0",
    "mobile": false,
    "settings": {
        "strategy": "japanese",
        "matchStrategy": "prefix",
        "maxNumberOfSuggestions": 15,
        "maxNumberOfWordsAsPhrase": 3,
        "minNumberOfCharactersTriggered": 0,
        "minNumberOfWordsTriggeredPhrase": 1,
        "complementAutomatically": true,
        "delayMilliSeconds": 50,
        "disableSuggestionsDuringImeOn": false,
        "insertAfterCompletion": false,
        "selectSuggestionKeys": "Enter",
        "additionalCycleThroughSuggestionsKeys": "None",
        "propagateEsc": true,
        "enableCurrentFileComplement": true,
        "onlyComplementEnglishOnCurrentFileComplement": true,
        "enableCustomDictionaryComplement": true,
        "customDictionaryPaths": "\n_Privates/dictionary-test.md\nhttps://raw.githubusercontent.com/first20hours/google-10000-english/master/google-10000-english-no-swears.txt\n_Privates/dictionary.md\n",
        "columnDelimiter": "Tab",
        "delimiterToHideSuggestion": "",
        "caretLocationSymbolAfterComplement": "",
        "enableInternalLinkComplement": true,
        "suggestInternalLinkWithAlias": false,
        "showLogAboutPerformanceInConsole": true,
        "overwriteDuplicatedExistedPhrase": true,
        "ignoreEnterKey": false,
        "ignoreTabKey": false,
        "onlySuggestFromCustomDictionaries": false,
        "switchNormalModeAfterPushingEsc": true,
        "delayMilliSec": 500
    }
}

docs.title: Since
docs.text:
v4.0.0

docs.title: 🗨️select with custom alias
docs.text:
This command inserts the selected suggestion along with a custom alias. The alias can be entered in a dialog that appears after the command is executed.

This feature is only available with Internal link complement.

docs.title: Default hotkey
docs.text: • None

docs.title: Related issues
docs.text: • Easily rename accepted internal link suggestion. · Issue #282

docs.title: Since
docs.text:
v9.3.0

BACKLINK_PLUGIN_5234737_PLACEHOLDER

docs.title: 🗨️select with query alias
docs.text:
This command uses the currently entered query as an alias to display completion suggestions. For example, if you type "obs" and select the suggestion "Obsidian" with this command, it will become [[Obsidian|obs]].

This feature is only available with Internal link complement. If you execute this command for suggestions other than Internal link complement, it will behave the same as the usual "select".

docs.title: Default hotkey
docs.text: • None

docs.title: Related issues
docs.text: • Add option to use current word as an alias (when linking) · Issue #268

docs.title: Since
docs.text:
v10.5.0

  • OFF

docs.title: OFF

BACKLINK_PLUGIN_5234737_PLACEHOLDER

docs.title: Definitions
docs.text:
• default: :/^

If you set :/^, Various Complements doesn't show suggestions after inputting a word that starts with :, /, or ^.

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: If we installed Natural Language Dates and ...

docs.title: Set :/^
docs.text: If we input @ and a word, Various Complements shows suggestions instead of Natural Language Dates.

docs.title: Set :/^@
docs.text: If we input @ and a word, Natural Language Dates shows suggestions because the word starts with @; therefore, Various Complements ignores the word.

docs.title: Related issues
docs.text: • Conflict with Natural Language Dates plugin and @ trigger · Issue #111

docs.title: Since
docs.text:
v5.11.0

BACKLINK_PLUGIN_5234737_PLACEHOLDER

docs.title: Definitions
docs.text:
• ON (default)
    • It shows suggestions matched fuzzy
  • OFF
    • It doesn't shows suggestions matched fuzzy

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• If ⚙️ Match strategy is prefix, it needs to match the first character even if "fuzzy match" is enabled
  • Exact-or-partial-matched results are always displayed above fuzzy-matched ones
  • There should be little or no performance degradation, but it may take twice the time, depending on the case
  • You can suppress suggestions that you find noisy with the ⚙️ Min fuzzy match score setting

docs.title: Related issues
docs.text: • support fuzzy matching · Issue #127

docs.title: Since
docs.text:
v8.0.0

BACKLINK_PLUGIN_5234737_PLACEHOLDER

docs.title: Definitions

• OFF (default)
  • ON

v3.0.0

BACKLINK_PLUGIN_5234737_PLACEHOLDER

docs.title: Definitions
docs.text: Regular expression line patterns (partial match) until the cursor, that suppresses the activation of autocomplete. Multiple patterns can be defined with line breaks.

docs.title: Related issues
docs.text: • Disable suggestions using terminal components of email address / URLs etc · Issue #162

docs.title: Since
docs.text:
v8.0.0

BACKLINK_PLUGIN_5234737_PLACEHOLDER

docs.title: Definitions
docs.text:
• prefix (default)
  • partial

docs.title: prefix
docs.text: Input orange doesn't suggest appleOrangeGrape because it doesn't start with orange or Orange.

docs.title: partial
docs.text: Input orange suggest appleOrangeGrape because it includes Orange.

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
There are two crucial points you should know.

  • partial suggests many suggestions, it might be noisy for you depending on the situation
  • partial is more than 10 times slower than prefix

docs.title: Related issues
docs.text: • Version 3.0 and above, the candidate words obtained are incomplete · Issue #41

docs.title: Since
docs.text:
v3.2.0

BACKLINK_PLUGIN_5234737_PLACEHOLDER

docs.title: Definitions
docs.text:
• default: 5
  • min: 1
  • max: 255

Note

It sometimes suggest under N1 items even if there are more than N items. So I recommend setting a little bigger than you want.

docs.title: Related issues
docs.text: • Does the word selection interface consider adding a page turning function, like the input method? · Issue #8

docs.title: Since
docs.text:
v1.1.0

BACKLINK_PLUGIN_5234737_PLACEHOLDER

  1. N is set value. ↩

docs.title: ⚙️ Max number of words as a phrase
Definitions
docs.text:
• default: 3
  • min: 1
  • max: 10

docs.title: Set to 1
docs.text: Input aws sam doesn't suggest [[AWS SAM]] as a first item because it regards a current word as not aws sam but sam. aws sam local is the same.

docs.title: Set to 3
docs.text:
Input aws sam suggests [[AWS SAM]] as a first item because it regards a current word as not sam but aws sam. aws sam local is the same.

If you input aws sam local, It shows suggestions according to the following priorities.

  1. Hit with aws sam local
  2. Hit with sam local
  3. Hit with local

docs.title: Related issues
docs.text: • FR: Support for multi-word-completions · Issue #24

docs.title: Since
docs.text:
v5.0.0

BACKLINK_PLUGIN_5234737_PLACEHOLDER

docs.title: Definitions
docs.text:
• default: 0.5
  • min: 0
  • max: 5.0

It only shows suggestions whose fuzzy matched score is more than the specific value.

docs.title: Notes
docs.text: • You need to enable the ⚙️ Fuzzy match setting

docs.title: Related issues
docs.text: • [Question] Can URLs be excluded from a fuzzy match search (strategy = partial). · Issue #227

docs.title: Since
docs.text:
v8.3.0

BACKLINK_PLUGIN_5234737_PLACEHOLDER

docs.title: ⚙️ Min number of characters for trigger
Definitions
docs.text:
Sets the minimum number of characters required for suggestions to be displayed. For example, if set to 3, suggestions will not appear when typing ho, but will appear when typing hos (if matching candidates exist).

  • default: 0
  • min: 0
  • max: 10

Setting the value to 0 does not mean the suggestion will be triggered without any inputted character. Depending on the ⚙️ Strategy you choose the actual value will be differ.

Strategy Actual value default 3 japanese 2 chinese 1 korean 1 arabic 3 english-only 3

If you want to change the setting value for different features like Custom dictionary complement or Internal link complement, use the following settings:

  • ⚙️ Min number of characters for trigger (Current file complement)
  • ⚙️ Min number of characters for trigger (Current vault complement)
  • ⚙️ Min number of characters for trigger (Custom dictionary complement)
  • ⚙️ Min number of characters for trigger (Internal link complement)

docs.title: Related issues
docs.text:
• Setting Suggestions: Delay & minimal word length · Issue #11
  • The custom dictionary feature suddenly stop working · Discussion #262

docs.title: Since
docs.text:
v1.2.0

BACKLINK_PLUGIN_5234737_PLACEHOLDER

docs.title: ⚙️ Min number of words for trigger
Definitions
docs.text:
• default: 1

BACKLINK_PLUGIN_5234737_PLACEHOLDER

docs.title: Definitions
docs.text: Regular expression patterns (exact match) that suppress the activation of autocomplete. Multiple patterns can be defined with line breaks.

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
If ⚙️ Match strategy is set to partial and ⚙️ Phrase patterns to suppress trigger is left empty, suggestions will be displayed.

However, if you specify for in ⚙️ Phrase patterns to suppress trigger, no autocomplete suggestions will appear.

BACKLINK_PLUGIN_5234737_PLACEHOLDER

docs.title: Definitions
docs.text:
It allows for the setting of hotkeys for popup commands.

  • Ctrl a means pressing the Ctrl key and the A key
  • Enter|Tab means pressing the Enter key or the Tab key
  • Use Mod instead of Ctrl on Windows or Cmd on macOS
  • You can find the keycode at keycode.info. Press any key to see the event.key value, except for the space key. Set the space key as 'Space'.
Command Default hotkey select Enter 🗨️select with custom alias 🗨️select with query alias up ArrowUp down ArrowDown select 1st select 2nd select 3rd select 4th select 5th select 6th select 7th select 8th select 9th open completion insert as text

docs.title: Related issues
docs.text:
• Feature Request: tab and return should accept a completion #138
  • Feature Request: Two-Step Completions #156
  • FR: Support Ctrl+J and Ctrl+K even on macOS #176
  • Feature Request: Space key to select suggestion #112

v9.0.0

BACKLINK_PLUGIN_5234737_PLACEHOLDER

docs.title: ⚙️ Exclude path glob patterns (Current vault complement)
Definitions
docs.text:
• Glob patterns to exclude files using advanced wildcard matching
  • More flexible than prefix patterns but with higher processing overhead
  • Supports complex patterns like **/attachments, **/*.{png,jpg}, Private/**
  • You can set multiple patterns by separating line breaks
  • default: (empty)

docs.title: Performance Considerations
docs.text:
Performance Warning

Glob patterns add processing overhead during file indexing. Use ⚙️ Exclude prefix path patterns (Current vault complement) when possible for better performance.

docs.title: Exclude files in attachments folders at any level
docs.text: **/attachments/**

docs.title: Exclude specific file types
docs.text:
**/*.{png,jpg,gif}
**/*.tmp

docs.title: Exclude files in directories at vault root
docs.text:
Private/**
Templates/**

docs.title: Complex patterns
docs.text:
**/attachments/**
**/*.{png,jpg,gif,pdf}
Private/**
Templates/drafts/**

docs.title: Implementation Details
docs.text:
• Invalid patterns are safely ignored with console warnings
  • Applied with OR logic - if any pattern matches, the file is excluded
  • Both prefix patterns and glob patterns are applied (files matching either are excluded)

docs.title: Related issues
docs.text: • Possible to exclude suffix path pattern? #354

docs.title: Since
docs.text:
v10.7.0

BACKLINK_PLUGIN_5234737_PLACEHOLDER

docs.title: ⚙️ Exclude prefix path patterns (Current vault complement)
Definitions
docs.text:
• If set path patterns, it doesn't read files whose path starts with the set value
  • You can set multiple paths by separating line breaks
  • default:

Notes/words/
Public/

BACKLINK_PLUGIN_5234737_PLACEHOLDER

docs.title: Definitions
docs.text:
• Tab (default)
  • Comma
  • Pipe

docs.title: Tab
docs.text:
😄       @smile  @laugh  @good
😐       @normal

docs.title: Comma
docs.text:
😄,,smile,@laugh,@good
😐,,@normal

docs.title: Pipe
docs.text:
😄||smile|@laugh|@good
😐||@normal

docs.title: Notes
docs.text: • For now, there are no ways to escape , and |, so I recommend to use Tab if you register , or | with 📚 Custom dictionaries

docs.text:
This is an example of a language dictionary file URL.

Language URL Size English https://raw.githubusercontent.com/first20hours/google-10000-english/master/google-10000-english-no-swears.txt 75KB Brazilian Portuguese https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ThomasEricB/words-pt-uncompressed-with-utf8-txt/master/wordsList.txt 14MB

If you are aware of any high-quality language files, please provide the URL so we can include them in our list.

docs.title: ⚙️ Exclude path glob patterns (Internal link complement)
Definitions
docs.text:
• Glob patterns to exclude internal links using advanced wildcard matching
  • More flexible than prefix patterns but with higher processing overhead
  • Supports complex patterns like **/attachments, **/*.{png,jpg}, Private/**
  • You can set multiple patterns by separating line breaks
  • default: (empty)

docs.title: Performance Considerations
docs.text:
Performance Warning

Glob patterns add processing overhead during file indexing. Use ⚙️ Exclude prefix path patterns (Internal link complement) when possible for better performance.

docs.title: Exclude files in attachments folders at any level
docs.text: **/attachments/**

docs.title: Exclude specific file types
docs.text:
**/*.{png,jpg,gif}
**/*.tmp

docs.title: Exclude files in directories at vault root
docs.text:
Private/**
Templates/**

docs.title: Complex patterns
docs.text:
**/attachments/**
**/*.{png,jpg,gif,pdf}
Private/**
Templates/drafts/**

docs.title: Implementation Details
docs.text:
• Invalid patterns are safely ignored with console warnings
  • Applied with OR logic - if any pattern matches, the internal link is excluded
  • Both prefix patterns and glob patterns are applied (links matching either are excluded)

docs.title: Related issues
docs.text: • Possible to exclude suffix path pattern? #354

v10.7.0

BACKLINK_PLUGIN_5234737_PLACEHOLDER

docs.title: ⚙️ Insert an alias that is transformed from the displayed internal link
Definitions
docs.text:
• ON
  • OFF (default)

docs.title: Motivations
docs.text:
As the Vault grows, there are notes with the same name in different contexts. Wikipedia has addressed these issues by adding bracketed suffixes to note names and removing the suffixes from the link display string. However, it also means we must insert the internal link with the alias. It is not efficient.

For these reasons, I have added a this option. For example, if you set

setting value Before: regular expression pattern with captures (?<name>.+) \(.+\)$ After $<name>

Then the plugin inserts the link, [[hoge (huga)]], as [[hoge (huga)|hoge]].

docs.title: Related issues
docs.text: • [Feature Request] Add Note Name as Alias · Issue #193

docs.title: Since
docs.text:
v8.0.0

docs.title: Definitions
docs.text:
Tags to exclude suggestions for internal links. If specifying multiple tags, separate them with line breaks.

  • default:

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
If "ignored" is specified, and there is a markdown file as follows,

---
tags: ignored
---

hogehoge

The plugin won't suggest an Internal link complement corresponding to the above file.

docs.title: Related issues
docs.text: • Internal link complement function excludes files containing specified tags from recommendations. · Issue #303

docs.title: Since
docs.text:
v10.4.0

BACKLINK_PLUGIN_5234737_PLACEHOLDER

docs.title: Support formats
docs.text: See 📚 Custom dictionary formats.

docs.title: Inserted text
docs.text: Inserted text is used for inserting text after selecting a suggestion but not used for matching.

docs.title: Displayed text
docs.text:
Displayed text is used for displaying suggestions and matching them.

Inserted text and Displayed text are the same except for the following cases.

  • Use ⚙️ Delimiter to divide suggestions for display from ones for insertion in 📚 Custom dictionary formats#CSV like format
  • Use ⚙️ Delimiter to hide a suggestion in 📚 Custom dictionary formats#CSV like format
  • Specify a displayed property in 📚 Custom dictionary formats#JSON format

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Description is used for showing a detail about a suggestion but not used for matching.

docs.title: Aliases
docs.text: Aliases are used for matching suggestions but never displayed.

docs.title: Caret location
docs.text:
See ⚙️ Caret location symbol after complement.

BACKLINK_PLUGIN_5234737_PLACEHOLDER

docs.title: 📚 Custom dictionary formats
docs.text:
📚 Custom dictionaries suppor two file formats.

  • CSV like
  • JSON

docs.title: Row delimiter
docs.text: Line breaks

docs.title: Column delimiter
docs.text: Value set in ⚙️ Column delimiter

docs.title: Column definitions
docs.text: Col1 Col2 Col3 and later Inserted text/Displayed text Description Aliases

docs.title: Comment syntax
docs.text: If a line starts with %%, It regards the line as a comment line.

docs.title: Escape syntax
docs.text: syntax actual text \n Line break \t Tab

docs.title: Other
docs.text:
• ⚙️ Delimiter to divide suggestions for display from ones for insertion
  • ⚙️ Delimiter to hide a suggestion

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
• ⚙️ Column delimiter: Comma
  • ⚙️ Delimiter to divide suggestions for display from ones for insertion: >>>
value1

%% with description %%
value2,description

%% with aliase %%
value3,,v3,val3

%% with \n %%
- one\n- two\n- three,,onetwo

%% Displayed text is different from Inserted text %%
Displayed >>> Inserted

It will load it as...

Inserted text Displayed text Description Aliases[0] Aliases[1] value1 value1 value2 value2 description value3 value3 v3 val3 - one- two- three - one- two- three onetwo Inserted Displayed

docs.title: Definitions
docs.text: key type required description caretSymbol string If set, take precedence over ⚙️ Caret location symbol after complement ignoreSpaceAfterCompletion boolean If set, ignore ⚙️ Insert space after completion words Word[] yes

docs.title: Word
docs.text: key type required description value string yes Inserted text description string Description aliases string[] Aliases displayed string If set, use as Displayed text

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
{
  "caretSymbol": "~CUR~",
  "ignoreSpaceAfterCompletion": true,
  "words": [
    { "value": "value1" },
    { "value": "value2", "description": "hogehoge" },
    { "value": "value3", "aliases": ["w3", "word3"] },
    { "value": "begin\n[[CARET]]\nend", "displayed": "code-json" }
  ]
}

It will load it as...

Inserted text Displayed text Description Aliases[0] Aliases[1] value1 value1 value2 value2 hogehoge value3 value3 w3 word3 begin~CUR~end code-json

~CUR~ is the caret location after completion.

docs.title: Related issues
docs.text: • FR: Use JSONs for Custom Dictionaries · Issue #108

docs.title: Since
docs.text:
v6.1.0

    }
  },
  "japanese": {
    "japanese": {
      "internalLink": {
        "count": 1,
        "lastUpdated": 1682827679147
      }
    }
  }
}

docs.title: 🖼️ Add a word to a custom dictionary dialog
docs.text:
A dialog for adding a word to a custom dictionary.

  • ① A custom dictionary file
  • ② Open a custom dictionary file button
  • ③ Word input form
    • If you selected words before open this dialog, the words is inserted here
  • ④ Description input form
  • ⑤ Aliases input form
  • ⑥ Submit button
  • ⑦ Distinguish between display and insertion toggle
    • Hidden if ⚙️ Delimiter to divide suggestions for display from ones for insertion isn't set

If it checks the ⑦, it changes the ③ to as follows.

docs.title: Since

  • ⚙️ Column delimiter: Comma
  • ⚙️ Delimiter to divide suggestions for display from ones for insertion: >>>
  • ⚙️ Displayed text suffix: => ...

docs.title: Open Phrasebank
docs.text:
Open Phrasebank is a repository created by liuh886. It provides an accessible phrase bank, which is a collection of frequently used phrases that can be utilized, for example, in the auto-complete function of an IDE.

For more details, please see the README below.

GitHub

GitHub - liuh886/open-phrasebank: Customize phrasebanks from various texts or corpora.

Customize phrasebanks from various texts or corpora. - GitHub - liuh886/open- ...

BACKLINK_PLUGIN_5234737_PLACEHOLDER

docs.title: I don't want suggestions to appear when IME is ON
docs.text:
Enable the ⚙️ Disable suggestions during IME on option.

When IME is on, all suggestions will be completely hidden. Of course, this makes them unavailable during text input in IME language, so use this option when you only want to use English autocomplete and similar cases.

docs.title: I don't want suggestions in Math blocks
docs.text:
Enable the ⚙️ Disable suggestions in the Math block option.

No suggestions will be displayed inside blocks enclosed by $$ and $$. However, this won't affect inline blocks like $1+1$.

docs.title: I want Enter to not select a suggestion unless I've pressed a selection key, similar to IME prediction
docs.text:
Enable the ⚙️ No auto-focus until the cycle option.

With this setting, even when suggestions are displayed, pressing Enter won't select them unless you've first pressed a cycle key (key to select next/previous suggestion).

docs.title: Issues with other auto-completion plugins not showing suggestions
docs.text:
Due to Obsidian's architecture, it's not possible to display two completion popups simultaneously. Therefore, the loading order of plugins determines which one takes precedence.

If other auto-completion plugins use first characters as triggers, you can specify them in the ⚙️ First characters to disable suggestions option of Various Complements to clarify the priority.

Please refer to the following issues for more information:

  • Various complements autocompletion blocks tasks autocompletion #318
  • Conflict with Natural Language Dates plugin and @ trigger #111

BACKLINK_PLUGIN_5234737_PLACEHOLDER

docs.title: ❓FAQ (Japanese)
docs.text: 日本語で書かれたFAQページです。

docs.title: 日本語だと半角スペースで区切らなければオートコンプリートが動作しない
docs.text: 日本語の単語区切りを判定するには、⚙️ Strategyがjapaneseに設定されている必要があります。デフォルト値はdefaultになっているため、設定変更していない場合はjapaneseに設定してください。

docs.title: 平仮名数文字の場合は候補を出さないでほしい
docs.text:
特に⚙️ Match strategyがpartialになっている場合は、平仮名2文字で大量の補完が表示されてしまいます。特定の入力パターンで候補を抑制するには、⚙️ Phrase patterns to suppress triggerを設定してください。

たとえば、平仮名2文字以内の入力を抑制したい場合は、以下のように設定します。

[\u3040-\u309F]{1,2}

この設定で『です』のような入力の場合、補完が表示されなくなります。

もし、平仮名だけでなくカタカナも含めたい場合は、以下のように設定します。

[\u3040-\u309F\u30A0-\u30FF]{1,2}

docs.title: 日本語入力のときは候補を出さないでほしい
docs.text:
⚙️ Disable suggestions during IME onを有効にしてください。

IMEがオン(日本語入力オン)のときは候補が一切表示されなくなります。もちろん、日本語のテキスト入力時に利用できなくなりますので、英語のオートコンプリートだけ利用したいケースなどでご利用ください。

docs.title: Mathブロックでは候補を出さないでほしい
docs.text:
⚙️ Disable suggestions in the Math blockを有効にしてください。

$$と$$で囲まれたブロック内では候補が一切表示されなくなります。ただし、$1+1$のようなインラインブロックの場合は効果がありません。

docs.title: IMEの予測変換のように候補が表示されても選択キーを押さなければEnterで選択しないようにしてほしい
docs.text:
⚙️ No auto-focus until the cycleオプションを有効にしてください。

候補が表示されてもサイクルキー(次/前の候補を選択するキー)を押さなければ、Enterで選択できないようになります。

docs.title: 他の自動補完プラグインが候補を表示しなくなってしまった
docs.text:
Obsidianの仕組み上、2つの補完ポップアップを同時に表示することはできません。そのため、プラグインのロード順によってどちらが優先されるかが決まってしまいます。

他の自動補完プラグインが先頭の文字をトリガーにしている場合は、Various Complementsの⚙️ First characters to disable suggestionsオプションに指定することで、優先順位を明確にできます。

以下のissueも参考にしてください。

  • Various complements autocompletion blocks tasks autocompletion #318
  • Conflict with Natural Language Dates plugin and @ trigger #111
